sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Aeva Technologies (NASDAQ:AEVA) Stock Price Down 5.5% - Here's Why
feed.summary: Aeva Technologies (NASDAQ:AEVA) stock fell 5.5% mid-day on Tuesday, with trading volume significantly below average. The company has a consensus "Hold" rating from analysts but faces financial challenges including negative EPS, low revenue, and substantial negative margins. Insider selling has also been noted, with CFO and CTO offloading shares recently.

feed.title: Aeva to Showcase Passenger OEM Vehicle with Windshield-Integrated 4D LiDAR and Introduce New Sensor Technology for Physical AI at CES 2026
feed.summary: Aeva (Nasdaq: AEVA) will showcase a passenger OEM vehicle featuring windshield-integrated 4D LiDAR and debut a new 4D LiDAR sensor at CES 2026. The company will demonstrate how its Frequency Modulated Continuous Wave (FMCW) perception platform is enabling advanced automation across automotive, robotics, factory automation, and smart infrastructure applications. Aeva will also introduce a new 4D LiDAR sensor specifically designed for advanced sensing and perception capabilities in Physical AI applications.

feed.title: Parkwood LLC Has $38.95 Million Position in Aeva Technologies, Inc. $AEVA
feed.summary: Parkwood LLC has reduced its stake in Aeva Technologies (NASDAQ:AEVA) by 27.8% in Q2, but it still represents the fund's third largest holding worth $38.95 million. Despite other institutions increasing their positions, analysts are mixed with a "Hold" rating, and the company remains deeply unprofitable with significant insider selling.

feed.title: What AEVA's New Auto Contract Means for Its Growth Outlook
feed.summary: Aeva Technologies (AEVA) has secured a significant multi-year contract with a major European car manufacturer to supply its Atlas Ultra sensor for production until the mid-2030s, excluding China. This Tier-1 award follows successful joint testing and is expected to drive future sales by reducing technical risks and building customer trust after rigorous evaluations. Despite this win, AEVA remains an early-stage company needing to prove its ability to scale manufacturing cost-effectively and achieve full customer approval before generating substantial revenue.

feed.title: What AEVA's New Auto Contract Means for Its Growth Outlook
feed.summary: Aeva Technologies (AEVA) has secured a significant multi-year deal with a major European car manufacturer, making its Atlas Ultra sensor the standard LiDAR for global vehicle models until the mid-2030s. This contract, following successful joint testing and a recent $100 million investment from Apollo, signals a crucial turning point for AEVA's future sales and mass production readiness, despite the company still operating at a loss. The deal validates AEVA's 4D LiDAR technology and strengthens its position in the competitive LiDAR market against rivals like Ouster and Luminar.

feed.title: Aeva (Nasdaq: AEVA) to present at 53rd Annual Nasdaq Investor Conference on Dec. 10
feed.summary: Aeva (Nasdaq: AEVA), a leader in next-generation sensing and perception systems, announced its participation in the 53rd Annual Nasdaq Investor Conference in London on December 10, 2025, with a fireside time at 3:30 PM GMT. The company focuses on accelerating autonomy across various applications with its lidar-on-chip technology. Aeva's 4D LiDAR sensors are designed to improve intelligent and safe decision-making for automated devices.

feed.title: Aeva to Participate at the Annual Nasdaq Investor Conference
feed.summary: Aeva (Nasdaq: AEVA), a leader in next-generation sensing and perception systems, announced its participation at the 53rd Annual Nasdaq Investor Conference in association with Morgan Stanley. The conference will take place in London, UK, on December 10, 2025, with Aeva's fireside chat scheduled for 3:30pm GMT. The company focuses on accelerating autonomy with its Lidar-on-chip technology for various applications.

feed.title: Aeva to Participate at the Annual Nasdaq Investor Conference
feed.summary: Aeva (Nasdaq: AEVA) announced its participation in the 53rd Annual Nasdaq Investor Conference, held in association with Morgan Stanley, in London, UK on December 10, 2025. The company specializes in next-generation sensing and perception systems, particularly 4D LiDAR sensors crucial for autonomous applications. Aeva aims to showcase its technology and engage with investors at this key industry event.

feed.title: Aeva to Participate at the Annual Nasdaq Investor Conference
feed.summary: Aeva (Nasdaq: AEVA) announced its participation in the 53rd Annual Nasdaq Investor Conference in association with Morgan Stanley. The conference will take place in London, UK, on December 10, 2025, with Aeva's fireside chat scheduled for 3:30 PM GMT. Aeva specializes in next-generation sensing and perception systems, including lidar-on-chip technology for various applications from automated driving to robotics.

feed.title: JPMorgan Chase & Co. Has $13.24 Million Position in Aeva Technologies, Inc. $AEVA
feed.summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. significantly increased its stake in Aeva Technologies, Inc. by 1,122.9% in Q2, acquiring an additional 321,775 shares to hold a total of 350,431 shares valued at $13.24 million. Despite this institutional interest, insiders CEO Soroush Salehian Dardashti and CFO Saurabh Sinha have recently sold a substantial number of shares, totaling 619,710 shares worth approximately $8.18 million over the last 90 days. Aeva Technologies remains unprofitable with negative EPS and margins, and analysts have mixed ratings on the stock, with a consensus target price of $26.50.

feed.title: Why Aeva Technologies (AEVA) Is Up 31.8% After Winning Exclusive FMCW 4D LiDAR Deal With Major European Automaker
feed.summary: Aeva Technologies (AEVA) stock rose 31.8% after securing an exclusive deal to supply its Atlas 4D LiDAR for Level 3 automated driving to a major European automaker. This multi-year program, extending into the mid-2030s, marks a significant shift in the automotive industry from conventional 3D time-of-flight sensors to Aeva's FMCW 4D LiDAR technology. The deal bolsters Aeva's position as a Tier-1 partner and strengthens its investment narrative around automotive automation.

feed.title: Aeva Technologies, Inc. (NASDAQ:AEVA) Given Consensus Recommendation of "Hold" by Brokerages
feed.summary: Aeva Technologies, Inc. (NASDAQ:AEVA) has received a consensus "Hold" recommendation from brokerages, with an average 12-month price target of $26.50. The company recently reported a loss of $0.46 EPS on $3.58 million in revenue, and insiders have sold approximately $8.18 million worth of stock. Shares opened at $14.70, down 7.4%, with a market capitalization of around $883 million.

feed.title: Why Is Aeva Technologies Stock Soaring Wednesday?
feed.summary: Aeva Technologies (NASDAQ: AEVA) stock is soaring after being selected as the exclusive lidar supplier for a major European automaker for its global vehicle platform outside China, targeting Level 3 automated driving. The multi-year program is expected to begin production in 2028 and run into the mid-2030s. This agreement highlights the industry's shift towards advanced lidar technology for autonomous vehicles and reinforces Aeva's position in the market.

feed.title: Canaccord Genuity Maintains Aeva Technologies (AEVA) Buy Recommendation
feed.summary: Canaccord Genuity has reaffirmed its "Buy" recommendation for Aeva Technologies (AEVA). Analysts have an average one-year price target of $24.59, suggesting a potential 79.64% upside from its last closing price. The company is projected to see significant annual revenue growth and has a bullish fund sentiment with institutional ownership increasing.

feed.title: Aeva Technologies, Inc. Wins Exclusive LiDAR Supplier Contract
feed.summary: Aeva Technologies, Inc. has secured an exclusive contract to supply LiDAR technology for a prominent European OEM's vehicle platform, with production starting in 2028 and extending into the mid-2030s. This agreement, announced on December 3, 2025, positions Aeva as a Tier-1 partner in the automotive industry and marks a transition to 4D LiDAR for the OEM's automated driving systems. Aeva's technology will be standardized across multiple vehicle models globally for Level 3 automated driving.

feed.title: Aeva Wins Exclusive Global Production Contract from Top European Passenger OEM
feed.summary: Aeva (Nasdaq: AEVA) has secured an exclusive multi-year contract as the LiDAR supplier for a top European passenger OEM's global series-production vehicle platform, targeting Level 3 automated driving. This partnership, following a successful joint development program, will integrate Aeva Atlas™ Ultra 4D LiDAR technology into millions of vehicles worldwide, excluding China, with production starting in 2028 and extending into the mid-2030s. This marks a significant move by a major automaker to adopt next-generation 4D LiDAR for automated driving across internal combustion, hybrid, and electric models.

feed.title: Aeva shares soar after deal with European automaker
feed.summary: Aeva Technologies shares gained over 18% after the company announced an exclusive deal to supply lidar units to a European automaker for autonomous vehicles. While the automaker was not named, analysts speculate it could be Mercedes-Benz. Aeva's sensors will be used for Level 3 autonomous driving functions in the automaker's combustion, electric, and hybrid vehicles outside of China, a partnership that Aeva executives previously estimated could be worth over $1 billion in sales.

feed.title: Aeva Technologies: Q3 Confirms The Story Is Still All Hype, No Progress
feed.summary: Aeva Technologies, Inc. (AEVA) is considered a high-risk investment due to minimal revenue growth, lack of mass-production contracts, and a significant cash burn rate of $9-10 million monthly. Despite partnerships, the company's cash reserves are projected to last only 1.5 quarters, necessitating further financing or dilution. Given worsening financials and market performance, the author rates AEVA as a Strong Sell.

feed.title: White & Case advises Apollo Funds on private placement of $US100 million convertible notes of Aeva Technologies, Inc.
feed.summary: White & Case LLP advised Apollo-managed funds on a $100 million private placement of 4.375% convertible senior notes due 2032 of Aeva Technologies, Inc. Aeva plans to use the proceeds to support its commercial momentum and accelerate the adoption of FMCW 4D LiDAR technology. The notes, sold privately under Rule 144A, have an initial conversion price of US$15.8643.

feed.title: Aeva Selected by World's Largest Commercial Aircraft Manufacturer
feed.summary: Aeva has been selected by Airbus UpNext to supply its 4D LiDAR technology for the Optimate smart automation demonstrator project. This collaboration aims to showcase Aeva's technology in the aviation industry, enabling automatic taxiing at airports with high-resolution data collection up to 500 meters. The project will test Aeva's 4D LiDAR on an Airbus A350-1000 flight test aircraft and an electrical truck during taxi operations at Toulouse-Blagnac and other international airports.

feed.title: Aeva Technologies (NASDAQ:AEVA) Stock Rating Upgraded by Wall Street Zen - MarketBeat
feed.summary: Wall Street Zen upgraded Aeva Technologies (NASDAQ:AEVA) stock rating from "sell" to "hold," while the consensus remains a "Moderate Buy" with an $18.33 target price. The company reported a negative EPS of ($0.55) but exceeded revenue expectations with $5.51 million. Recent insider transactions showed significant sales by the CFO and CTO, decreasing their holdings by 4.52% and 7.17% respectively.

feed.title: Ouster's Margin Continues to Improve: Can It Retain the Momentum?
feed.summary: Ouster Inc. has significantly improved its net margin over the past two years, despite still operating at a loss, by focusing on revenue growth, cost optimization, and transitioning to software-enabled solutions. The company aims for 30-50% annual revenue growth and profitability in the next couple of years, positioning itself in a growing $19 billion market by 2030, though its valuation is currently high compared to competitors like Aeva Technologies and Luminar Technologies. Ouster's shares have gained 201.4% year to date, but estimates for its Q3 and Q4 2025 EPS and revenues show no recent movement over the past 30 days.

feed.title: Can AEVA's LiDAR Redefine Safety in Intelligent Transport? - The Globe and Mail
feed.summary: Aeva Technologies is expanding its 4D LiDAR sensor technology beyond automotive into Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS), partnering with Sensys Gatso Australia for mobile speed enforcement. The company's Atlas sensor provides accurate and reliable velocity detection, addressing a significant factor in traffic fatalities. This move, along with advancements from companies like Innoviz Technologies and Ouster, highlights the growing trend towards smart infrastructure and enhanced road safety through advanced LiDAR solutions.

feed.title: Aeva Announces Date for Third Quarter 2025 Results and Conference Call
feed.summary: Aeva (Nasdaq: AEVA) announced it will report its third-quarter 2025 financial results after market close on Wednesday, November 5, 2025. The company will host a conference call and webcast on the same day at 2:00 p.m. Pacific Time (5:00 p.m. Eastern Time) to discuss these results. An archive of the webcast will be available on Aeva's investor relations website for 12 months.

feed.title: Aeva Reports First Quarter 2025 Results
feed.summary: Aeva (NASDAQ: AEVA) announced its first quarter 2025 financial results, highlighting record product revenue and strategic advancements. Key achievements include the introduction of the Aeva Eve 1D high-precision sensor with initial orders for over 1,000 units, progress on a global top 10 passenger OEM development program, and a strategic collaboration and investment agreement totaling up to $50M from a Global Fortune 500 company to expand into new markets. The company reported $3.4 million in revenue, a GAAP operating loss of $30.4 million, and a non-GAAP operating loss of $25.9 million for the quarter.

feed.title: Aeva Technologies Inc. (AEVA) reports earnings
feed.summary: Aeva Technologies Inc. (AEVA) filed its 10-K report for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2024, reporting a net loss of $152.3 million despite revenue growth to $9.1 million. The company focuses on its 4D LiDAR-on-chip technology and believes its current liquidity is sufficient for the next 12 months, even after a class action lawsuit settlement.

feed.title: Aeva to supply self-driving sensors to NTT-backed May Mobility
feed.summary: Aeva Technologies has announced a deal to supply lidar sensors to May Mobility for its self-driving shuttles. This agreement will provide sensors for thousands of May Mobility vehicles through 2028, bolstering the startup's long-range sensing capabilities. May Mobility, which recently raised $105 million in venture capital, focuses on selling self-driving shuttle services to cities and local governments.

feed.title: May Mobility Selects Aeva as Exclusive Production Supplier of Long-Range LiDAR
feed.summary: Aeva has been selected as the exclusive supplier of long-range LiDAR sensors for May Mobility's autonomous vehicles globally. This multi-year supply agreement extends through 2028, with deliveries beginning this year and production ramping in 2025. May Mobility will leverage Aeva's 4D LiDAR technology to enhance its autonomous transit model, aiming for safer, more sustainable, accessible, and equitable transportation.

feed.title: Aeva inks sensor deal with Nikon for industrial machines
feed.summary: Aeva Technologies has signed a deal to produce high-precision lidar sensors for Nikon's industrial machines, which will scan objects like cars for microscopic defects. These Aeva sensors aim to make Nikon's defect detection machines smaller, cheaper, and faster, allowing for 100% inspection rates for automakers. Aeva expects to start supplying sensors in 2024, with Nikon products featuring these sensors available by 2025.

feed.title: Losing 9% Weekly AEVA Stock On Race to Become Top Loser
feed.summary: Aeva Technologies Inc. (NYSE: AEVA) stock experienced significant losses weekly and monthly, despite a positive annual price target projection. The article details AEVA's recent trading performance, revenue and EPS figures for Q1 2023, and ownership distribution among institutional investors and individual shareholders. Technical analysis suggests potential resistance and support levels for the stock in the near future.

feed.title: Aeva Selects Fabrinet to Manufacture World’s First 4D LiDAR Chip Module
feed.summary: Aeva has chosen Fabrinet to manufacture its 4D LiDAR chip module, which is crucial for its unique frequency modulated continuous wave (FMCW) technology. This partnership establishes an advanced production line in Thailand, enabling mass production of Aeva's third-generation modules for automotive and industrial applications. This collaboration aims to accelerate Aeva's manufacturing capabilities and bring its perception technology to a broader range of devices.

feed.title: Aeva announces customer deal; shares soar even after results disappoint
feed.summary: Aeva Technologies Inc. announced a deal to develop a sensor for an "undisclosed large company's" self-driving car program, causing its shares to surge 13% despite reporting disappointing financial results. The company's first-quarter revenue fell short of estimates, and its operating loss more than doubled. Aeva, founded by ex-Apple engineers, specializes in lidar technology for autonomous vehicles and recently went public through a reverse merger.

feed.title: Self-driving startup Aeva says its sensor can detect vehicles over 500m away
feed.summary: Self-driving sensor startup Aeva Technologies Inc. announced that its lidar sensor can detect other vehicles beyond 500 meters and pedestrians over 350 meters away. This advanced detection range is a crucial metric for autonomous vehicles, enabling them to make timely decisions at high speeds. Aeva, founded by former Apple Inc. engineers, has secured deals with automotive suppliers Denso Corp and ZF Friedrichshafen AG for mass production of its sensors.

feed.title: Aeva's founders say they're ready to grow their lidar company after its $3.7B Wall Street debut
feed.summary: Aeva, a Mountain View-based lidar company, saw its stock soar by as much as 45% on its first day of trading, with its market cap fluctuating between $3 billion and $4 billion. The co-founders, Soroush Salehian and Mina Rezk, expressed their readiness to grow the company after its strong Wall Street debut.

feed.title: Aeva and InterPrivate Acquisition Corp. Announce Closing of Business Combination; Aeva to Trade on NYSE as "AEVA" Beginning On March 15
feed.summary: Aeva and InterPrivate Acquisition Corp. have completed their business combination, resulting in Aeva Technologies, Inc. going public. Its common stock and warrants will begin trading on the NYSE under "AEVA" and "AEVAW" on March 15, 2021. The transaction is expected to generate over $560 million in gross proceeds to support Aeva's growth and production plans.
